word:
Chapter VI. - The Consequence of Violating Natural Law.

     72. Proportionately as nature's laws are transgressed, mind and soul become enfeebled. . . . Physical suffering of every type is seen. . . . Suffering must follow this course of action. The vital force of the system cannot bear up under the tax placed upon it, and it finally breaks down.-- U. T., Aug. 30, 1896.
